intro: Coussapoa schottii var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found growing in shaded, moist areas of the understory. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
